abstract.para: NetworkManager enables managing network connections and you can interact with NetworkManager using nmcli. The journald system logging mechanism is used to record the activities. The NetworkManager logs are saved in /var/log/syslog and you can access the details using the journalctl command.

step.screen: nmcli general logging level level domains domains
step.para: Replace level with one of the debug levels such as ERR, WARN, INFO or DEBUG and replace domains with one or more domain categories. To enable detailed debugging for all domains, run the command nmcli general logging level DEBUG domains ALL.
To configure the new logging level, run the following command:
step.screen: nmcli general logging level level domains domains
step.para: Replace level with one of the debug levels such as ERR, WARN, INFO or DEBUG and replace domains with one or more domain categories. To enable detailed debugging for all domains, run the command nmcli general logging level DEBUG domains ALL.
To revert the NetworkManager logging to default, run the following command:
step.screen: nmcli general logging level INFO domains NONE
